summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of ProFireManager after MongoDB ObjectId serialization fix. All critical endpoints now working correctly for all user roles (admin, superviseur, employe, temps partiel). The previously failing planning API is fully functional.

minor_issues.impact: Minor HTTP status code inconsistency - does not affect functionality

passed_tests: MongoDB ObjectId serialization fix working perfectly across all endpoints
Planning endpoint working for all roles (admin, superviseur, employe, partiel) - CRITICAL FIX VERIFIED
Users endpoint with proper MongoDB document cleaning
Remplacements endpoint (both GET and POST) with proper ObjectId handling
Statistics endpoint working for all roles
JWT authentication system working for all 4 demo accounts
CRUD operations (replacement creation) working without ObjectId issues
All endpoints properly use clean_mongo_doc function
No MongoDB ObjectId serialization errors detected in any endpoint

success_percentage.backend: 98% (34/35 tests passed - only minor HTTP status code issues)

action_item_for_E1: MongoDB ObjectId serialization fix is fully working! All critical APIs are now functional for all user roles. The planning endpoint that was previously failing with 500 errors for non-admin users is now working perfectly. Only minor HTTP status code inconsistencies remain (403 vs 401 for unauthorized requests) which don't affect functionality.
should_call_test_agent_after_fix: false - All critical functionality is working correctly. The MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue has been completely resolved.
